citation.article-title: Catellatospora, a new genus of the Actinomycetales.

p.s: Catellatospora (Ca.tell.a.to.spo'ra. L. n. catella small chain; Gr. n. spora a seed; L. f. n. Catellatospora [organism forming] small chain of spores)
Vegetative hyphae are branched but not fragmented.
No true aerial mycelium is produced.
Short chains of nonmotile spores arise singly or in tufts from the vegetative hyphae on the surface of agar media.
Cell walls contain meso-diaminopimelic and 3-hydroxydiaminopimelic acids, glycine (cell wall type 11), and glycolic acid (glycolyl type).
Xylose and arabinose are present in cell hydrolysates (whole-cell sugar pattern D).
Characteristic phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol, and phosphatidylinositol mannosides (phopholipid pattern type PII).
The type species is C. citrea.
